title: QTestFixture can't write xml output if target path does not exist

content.raw: The tests all write junit xml files to the `test_results` folder in the build folder. The gtest and `check_test_ran` tests are able to create that folder if it doesn't exist, but QTestFixture does not create the folder. We generally don't see this problem since the gui tests don't run first when `make test` is called. This isn't a big deal, just something I ran into while working on flaky test detection.
content.html: The tests all write junit xml files to the test_results folder in the build folder. The gtest and check_test_ran tests are able to create that folder if it doesn't exist, but QTestFixture does not create the folder. We generally don't see this problem since the gui tests don't run first when make test is called. This isn't a big deal, just something I ran into while working on flaky test detection.
